articles.title: WPK Conference Holds Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as Eternal General Secretary of WPK
articles.content:
WPK Holds Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as Eternal General Secretary 
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Fourth Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea decided to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the WPK. The conference took place at a stirring time when all the service personnel and people of the DPRK are turning out in the great historic advance for fresh victory of the Juche revolution. 
					 The Conference solemnly declared internally and externally that it decided to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the WPK and glorify his revolutionary career and immortal revolutionary exploits for all ages. 
					
					 The participants paid highest tribute to the WPK which will shine along with the august name of the sun for all ages and loudly shouted "Hurrah!" with ardent reverence and excitement. 
					
					 The decision to have Kim Jong Il, the genius of ideas and theories, legendary great man and ever-victorious brilliant Songun commander produced by mankind, at the top post of the WPK for all ages and fully preserve and glorify his leadership exploits represents the eternal happiness of millions of party members, service personnel and all other people, his soldiers and disciples, and a great event of the sun's nation. 
					
					 The Conference strikingly demonstrated the strong will of the army and people of the DPRK to develop the WPK into the eternal party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il under the experienced and tested leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, regarding the behests of Kim Jong Il as important guidelines of the WPK, and glorify his revolutionary career and undying exploits for all ages and advance to the last along the road of independence, Songun and socialism. 
					
					 All the participants are full of revolutionary enthusiasm to work hard to accomplish the cause of Juche revolution and achieve ultimate victory of building a thriving socialist nation with the great national pride and honor of having Kim Jong Il at the top post of the WPK forever. 
					
					 The WPK which shines with the ever-lasting august names of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il will lead to one victory after another the army and people of the DPRK advancing under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, symbol of the might of Songun Korea and a banner for all victories and glory, and demonstrate the might of the country of Songun before the whole world for all ages.

articles.title: WPK Conference Elects Kim Jong Un as First Secretary of WPK
articles.content:
WPK Conference Elects Kim Jong Un as First Secretary of WPK
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Fourth Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea elected the dear respected Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the WPK and people of the DPRK, as first secretary of the WPK, true to the behest of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Conference solemnly declared internally and externally that Kim Jong Un was elected first secretary of the WPK, reflecting the unanimous wishes of all the party members, servicepersons and all other people.
					
					 All the participants paid highest tribute and extended warmest congratulations to him, loudly shouting "Hurrah!" with immense excitement, joy and profound respect.
					
					 His election as first secretary of the WPK is an expression of absolute support for and trust in the supreme commander of the Korean People's Army by all party members, servicepersons and other people. He has developed the revolutionary idea of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu to glorify it as Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism with his gifted wisdom and through energetic ideological and theoretical activities and put forth unique ideas and theories of the revolution and construction and all other fields including politics, military affairs, economy and culture and successfully materialized them, thus making outstanding contributions to the Juche-based army building through his energetic Songun leadership.
					
					 It also marks a great political event that demonstrates to the full the unshakable will of the army and people of the DPRK to fully preserve and glorify the immortal revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il and accomplish generation after generation the revolutionary cause of Juche, the Songun revolutionary cause started in Mt. Paektu, under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Only victory and glory will always be in store for the army and people of the DPRK advancing under the guidance of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Un and the party and country holding the great sun in high esteem will shine more brilliantly along with the new century of Kim Il Sung's Korea.

articles.title: WPK Conference Adopts Decision on Revision of Party Rules
articles.content:
WPK Conference Adopts Decision on Revision of Party Rules
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Fourth Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea adopted a decision on revising the "WPK rules."
					 Leader Kim Jong Il devoted his all till the last moments of his great life to the prosperity of the country and the victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche with his gifted wisdom, outstanding leadership ability, indomitable will and ardent love for the people. The revolutionary feats performed by him serve as a precious boon and the eternal cornerstone of the WPK and the Korean revolution.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un laid out a historic policy on holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as general secretary of the WPK forever and carrying to completion the revolutionary cause of Juche, the Songun revolutionary cause, that was started by President Kim Il Sung and led by Kim Jong Il, with a deep insight into the requirements of the party and the revolution. He indicated the orientation and ways for revising the WPK rules based on the policy.
					
					 The proposal for the revision of the WPK rules presented to the Fourth Conference of the WPK newly defined that Kim Jong Il is the eternal general secretary of the WPK and eternal leader of the WPK and the Korean people and that the WPK is the party of Kim Il Sung and      Kim Jong Il, reflecting the unanimous desire and wish of all the party members and other people. It also supplemented the undying revolutionary feats performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the party, the revolution, the country and its people.
					
					 The proposal defined that the WPK will take Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as the only guiding idea of the party and hold fast to the policy of modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism and Kimjongilism as the supreme programme of the party and that it will struggle for the victory of the cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the revolutionary cause of Juche, under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It was also defined in the proposed rules that the new post of first secretary of the WPK will be created and he will represent and lead the whole party as its head and will materialize the ideas and line of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: 4th Conference of WPK Held
articles.content:
4th Conference of WPK Held 
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Fourth Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) took place with splendor in Pyongyang, capital of the revolution, Wednesday.
					 The Conference was convened at a time of historic turn when a march of new 100 years of Kim Il Sung's Korea has begun to win the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, true to the behest of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the WPK and people of the DPRK, was present there.
					
					 Delegates elected at the meetings of delegates of the party organisations of the Korean People's Army and party organizations of provinces and political bureaus attended the Conference.
					
					 Present there as observers were officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, servicepersons, officials in the fields of science, education, public health, culture and arts and media.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam made an opening address.
					
					 Choe Yong Rim worked as chairman upon the authorization of the consultative meeting of the provincial delegates.
					
					 The Conference decided on the following agenda items:
					
					1. On holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and glorifying his revolutionary career and undying revolutionary feats for all ages.
					
					2. On the revision of the Workers' Party of Korea rules.
					
					3. On electing the dear respected Kim Jong Un to the top post of the Workers' Party of Korea, true to the behest of Kim Jong Il.
					
					4. On the organizational matter.
					
					 The Conference discussed the first agenda item.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam made a report.
					
					 He said Kim Jong Il wisely led the WPK, the army and people of the DPRK with his outstanding ideas, extraordinary leadership and noble virtue for half a century, thus performing undying feats on behalf of the country, the revolution, the times and history.
					
					 Kim Jong Il perfectly solved the issue of succession to the leadership with a strong sense of responsibility for the destiny of the country and the people and the future of the revolution, the speaker added. This was his distinguished feat. 
					
					 He courteously proposed to the Conference of the WPK to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the WPK and glorify his revolutionary life and undying revolutionary feats for all ages, reflecting the unshakable faith and will of all the party members, service persons and other people.
					
					 Speeches were made by Kim Ki Nam, delegate of the party organization of South Hwanghae Province, Kim Jong Gak, delegate of the KPA party organization, Yang Hyong Sop, delegate of the party organization of North Hwanghae Province, Ro Tu Chol, delegate of the party organisation of South Hamgyong Province and An Tong Chun, delegate of the party organization of the Ministry of Culture.
					
					 The speakers fully supported the proposal.
					
					 They called for holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as general secretary of the WPK and eternal leader of the Korean revolution for all ages and invariably glorifying the DPRK as a prosperous socialist country of Juche.
					
					 Read out at the Conference was a decision on holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the WPK and glorifying his revolutionary career and undying revolutionary feats for all ages.
					
					 All the participants shouted hurrahs, greatly honored and excited to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the WPK.
					
					 The second agenda item was discussed next.
					
					 A decision on the revision of the WPK rules was adopted.
					
					 The Conference discussed the third agenda item.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam made a speech on electing Kim Jong Un to the top post of the WPK, true to the behest of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said Kim Jong Un represents the center of unity of the WPK and the revolution, the center of the leadership as well as the banner of all victories and glory of Songun Korea.
					
					 It is the ardent wish and unshakable will of the army and people of the DPRK to hold Kim Jong Un at the top post of the WPK, he said.
					
					 He courteously proposed to the Conference to elect Kim Jong Un as first secretary of the WPK, reflecting the unanimous will of the participants in the Conference, all the party members, service persons and other people throughout the country.
					
					 The floor was taken by Choe Ryong Hae, delegate of the KPA party organization, Jon Yong Nam, delegate of the party organization of North Phyongan Province, Hyon Sang Ju, delegate of the party organization of North Hamgyong Province, Ri Myong Gil, delegate of the party organization of South Hwanghae Province, and Jang Chol, delegate of the party organization of South Phyongan Province.
					
					 The speakers fully supported and approved the proposal on electing Kim Jong Un as first secretary of the WPK, and pledged themselves to uphold his leadership with loyalty. 
					
					 A decision on electing Kim Jong Un as first secretary of the WPK was read out reflecting the unanimous desire and wishes of all the party members, service persons and other people of the DPRK.
					
					 All the participants burst into thunderous cheers of "Hurrah!" and warmly congratulated Kim Jong Un. They were full of national pride and self-esteem of having at the top post of the WPK Kim Jong Un, a great statesman, outstanding strategist and kind-hearted leader of the Korean people who is possessed of brilliant ideas and theories and matchless leadership ability. They were also convinced of the final victory of the Songun revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 The Conference declared that First Secretary of the WPK Kim Jong Un was elected member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK according to the WPK rules and detailed rules on the election of the supreme guidance body of the WPK. 
					
					 The fourth agenda item of the Conference was discussed next.
					
					 A member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee was elected to fill a vacancy and members and alternate members of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee were recalled and elected to fill vacancies.
					
					 Secretaries of the WPK Central Committee were recalled and elected to fill vacancies.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the WPK Central Military Commission was elected and its members recalled and elected to fill vacancies.
					
					 Members and alternate members of the WPK Central Committee were recalled and elected to fill vacancies and department directors of the WPK Central Committee appointed.
					
					 Members of the WPK Central Auditing Commission were recalled and elected to fill vacancies.
					
					 The Fourth Conference of the WPK marked an important political event that strikingly demonstrated the revolutionary faith and will of the party members, service persons and all other people to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as general secretary of the WPK for all ages and win new victory of the revolution of Juche, closely rallied behind the WPK Central Committee led by Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Members of WPK Central Guidance Body Elected to Fill Vacancies, Elected and Appointed
articles.content:
Members of WPK Central Guidance Body Elected to Fill Vacancies, Elected and Appointed
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Members of the party central guidance body were elected to fill vacancies, elected and appointed at the 4th Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Choe Ryong Hae was elected member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Party Central Committee, Kim Jong Gak, Jang Song Thaek, Pak To Chun, Hyon Chol Hae, Kim Won Hong and Ri Myong Su members of the Political Bureau of the Party Central Committee, Kwak Pom Gi, O Kuk Ryol, Ro Tu Chol, Ri Pyong Sam and Jo Yon Jun alternate members of the Political Bureau of the Party Central Committee to fill vacancies.
					
					 Kim Kyong Hui and Kwak Pom Gi were elected secretaries of the Party Central Committee.
					
					  Choe Ryong Hae was elected vice-chairman of the Party Central Military Commission and Hyon Chol Hae, Ri Myong Su and Kim Rak Gyom were elected members of the Party Central Military Commission to fill vacancies.
					
					 Members and alternate members of the Party Central Committee were elected to fill vacancies.
					
					 Kim Yong Chun, Kwak Pom Gi and Pak Pong Ju were appointed as department directors of the Party Central Committee.
					
					 Members of the Party Central Auditing Commission were elected to fill vacancies.

articles.title: Brief History of Member of Presidium, Members and Alternate Members of Political Bureau of C.C., WPK Elected to Fill Vacancies
articles.content:
Brief History of Member of Presidium, Members and Alternate Members of Political Bureau of C.C., WPK Elected to Fill Vacancies
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- 
					Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau
					
					 Born in Sinchon County, South Hwanghae Province, on Jan. 15, 1950.
					
					 Joined the Korean People's Army in September 1967.
					
					 Graduated from Kim Il Sung University as a political and economic expert. 
					
					 He was vice department director, department director and vice-chairman of the C.C., the League of the Socialist Working Youth of Korea, first secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, chief secretary of the North Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the WPK and secretary of the C.C., WPK.
					
					Now director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA since April 2012.
						
					
					 Kim Jong Gak, member of the Political Bureau
					
					Born in Jungsan County, South Phyongan Province, on July 20, 1941.
					
					Joined the KPA in August 1959.
					
					 Graduated from Kim Il Sung Military University.
					
					 He was a battalion commander, vice commander of a corps, chief of staff and director of a training center, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces and first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA.
					
					Now minister of the People's Armed Forces since April 2012.
						
					
					 Jang Song Thaek, member of the Political Bureau
					
					 Born in Chongam District, Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province on Jan. 22, 1946.
					
					 Graduated from Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 He was instructor of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, instructor, vice section chief, section chief, vice department director, first vice department director and department director of the C.C., the WPK 
					
					 Now vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and director of the Administration Department of the C.C., WPK since June, 2010.
					
					 
					
					 Pak To Chun, member of the Political Bureau
					
					 Born in Rangrim County, Jagang Province on March 9, 1944.
					
					 Joined the KPA in October 1960.
					
					Graduated from Kim Il Sung Higher Party School.
					
					He was secretary of the party committee of a mine, instructor, vice section chief and section chief of the C.C., the WPK, secretary and concurrently department director of a provincial party committee and chief secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK 
					
					Now secretary of the C.C., the WPK since September 2010.
						
					
					 Hyon Chol Hae, member of the Political Bureau
					
					 Born in Kyongsong County, North Hamgyong Province on August 13, 1934.
					
					 Joined the KPA in July 1950.
					
					 Graduated from a university as ship engineer. 
					
					 He was instructor in charge and director of the Organizational Department of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, director of the Political Department of a corps, director the General Logistic Bureau and vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, director of the Political Department and concurrently director of the General Affairs Bureau of the DPRK National Defence Commission. 
					
					Now first vice-minister and concurrently director of the General Logistic Bureau of the People's Armed Forces since April 2012.
						
					
					 Kim Won Hong, member of the Political Bureau
					
					 Born in Sungho County, North Hwanghae Province on July 17, 1945.
					
					 Joined the KPA in Nov 1962.
					
					 Graduated from Kim Il Sung Higher Party School.
					
					 He was instructor, section chief and vice department director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, political commissar and commander of a corps and vice director of the Organizational Department of the General Political Bureau of the KPA. 
					
					 Now minister of State Security since April, 2012.
					
					 
					
					 Ri Myong Su, member of the Political Bureau 
					
					 Born in Myongchon County, North Hamgyong Province on Feb. 20, 1934
					
					 Joined the KPA in July 1950.
					
					 Graduated from Kim Il Sung Military University.
					
					 He was director of the operational department of a corps, its chief of staff and commander, first vice-chief of the General Staff and concurrently its operational director and director of the Administration Affairs Bureau of the NDC.
					
					 Now minister of People's Security since April 2011 
					
					 
					
					 Kwak Pom Gi, alternate member of the Political Bureau
					
					Born in Riwon County, South Hamgyong Province on Nov. 20, 1939.
					
					 Graduated from Kim Il Sung University as planning economist.
					
					 He was manager  of the branch factory of the Huichon Machine Tool Factory, first vice-minister and minister of Machine Industry, vice- premier of the Cabinet and chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK.
					
					Now secretary of the C.C., the WPK since April 2012.
						
					
					 O Kuk Ryol, alternate member of the Political Bureau
					
					 Born in Onsong County, North Hamgyong Province on Jan. 7, 1930.
					
					 Joined the KPA in May 1949.
					
					Graduated from Air Force University.
					
					He was vice-commander of the Air Force Command, rector of Air Force University, commander of the Air Force, chief of the General Staff of the KPA and department director of the C.C., the WPK.
					
					 Now vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission since February 2009.
						
					
					 Ro Tu Chol, alternate member of the Political Bureau
					
					 Born in Hungdok District, Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province on Oct. 2, 1950.
					
					 Graduated from Kim Chaek University of Technology as fluid machine engineer.
					
					 He was instructor, vice department director and department director and vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission and vice-premier of the Cabinet. 
					
					Now vice-premier of the Cabinet and concurrently chairman of the State Planning Commission since April 2009.
						
					
					 Ri Pyong Sam, alternate member of the Political Bureau
					
					 Born in Mundok County, South Phyongan Province on July 1, 1935.
					
					Graduated from Kim Il Sung Military University. 
					
					He was instructor, vice director and director of the Political Department of a corps and its political commissar, vice-director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA and vice department director of the C.C., the WPK.
					
					 Now director of the Political Bureau of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and concurrently chief secretary of its party committee since May 2009.
					
					 
					
					 Jo Yon Jun, alternate member of the Political Bureau
					
					 Born in Kowon County, South Hamgyong Province on Sept. 28, 1937.
					
					 Joined the KPA in August 1954.
					
					 Graduated from Kim Il Sung University as political and economic expert. 
					
					 He was senior teacher at Kim Il Sung University, instructor, vice section chief and section chief of the C.C., the WPK, organizational secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK and vice department director of the C.C., the WPK. 
					
					 Now first vice department director of the Organizational Leadership Department of the C.C., the WPK since Jan 2012.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Ila
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un together with the participants in the Fourth Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun Wednesday and paid high tribute to President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Kim Jong Un together with them entered the hall where portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are displayed. 
					
					 A floral basket in the name of the participants of the Conference was placed before the portraits. 
					
					 Written on the ribbon of the floral basket were letters "The great Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us".
					
					 Kim Jong Un together with the participants in the Conference paid respectful homage to the portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the humblest reverence.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from C.C., CPC
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from C.C., CPC
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China upon his election as first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The floral basket was handed to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, by Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, on Wednesday.
					
					 A floral basket to Kim Jong Un was conveyed in the name of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Experts on Space Science and Technology and Media Persons Visit General Satellite Control and Command Center
articles.content:
Space Experts, Media Persons Visit General Satellite Control and Command Center
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Experts on space science and technology and media persons from different countries Wednesday visited the General Satellite Control and Command Center in Pyongyang in the run-up to the DPRK's launch of the first working satellite. 
					 They heard with keen attention that general secretary Kim Jong Il visited the modern Center on April 5, 2009 after its construction and observed the liftoff of Kwangmyongsong-2.
					
					 The Center, a comprehensive center for observing and controlling satellites of Kwangmyongsong series, is also a base for conducting scientific researches essential for the development of the national economy including earth observation and communications.
					
					 The Center is equipped with command communications system and computer intranet for calculation and data service concerning lift-off and observation and all facilities for controlling satellites.
					
					 The final preparations for the blast-off of earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 are now under way at the Center.
					
					 The visitors looked round the general command room.
					
					 They had detailed understanding of the mission of the general command room to gather real-time data on observation of satellites from the observatories in several places inside the country and handle them and thus monitor satellites, confirm their orbit and command the overall system of control and command on the ground.
					
					 They also learned about the assembling of the carrier rocket and preparations for the lift-off at the Sohae Launching Station on the screen in the control room.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Winning New Victory of Juche Revolution
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Turning Out in Struggle for Independence, Democracy and Reunification
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The grim situation of south Korea for the past four years when Lee Myung Bak and the "Saenuri Party" were in power forces the youth and students to turn out in the active struggle for independence and democracy of society and the country's reunification, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					 Citing facts to prove that young people and students have suffered a lot from the unpopular rule enforced by traitor Lee Myung Bak with its back turned on the nation during his tenure of office, the article goes on:
					
					 The young people and students are in a miserable plight as they have no youthful vigor and even attempt suicide with no hope in life.    Youth and students, strong in the sense of justice and aspiring after new things, can not accept the wretched situation as granted.
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff that Park Geun Hye of the "Saenuri Party" can not know nor would want to know about the difficulties of the youth and students as she was raised in a back room of Chongwadae well fed and well dressed.
					
					 It is clear that if the "Saenuri Party" is allowed to dominate the "National Assembly" again, the conditions of youth and students and working masses will become worse.
					
					 Youth and students should fulfill their sacred responsibility and duty before the era and the nation by dealing a blow to the group of the "Saenuri Party" in the today's "election". This is the road of patriotism for independence, democracy and reunification, the cherished desire of the south Korean people.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on S. Korean People's Firm Will to Punish Conservative Regime
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on S. Korean People's Firm Will to Punish Conservative Regime 
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Punishment of the conservative regime is required by mind-set in south Korea, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article. 
					 The south Korean people's actions to punish the conservative regime is an eruption of the pent-up grudge and resentment against the treacherous policy of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and a just struggle to root out the dictatorship, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The country-selling regime forsaken by the nation for its suppression of people will never last long. 
					
					 Over the last four years south Koreans from all walks of life have waged ceaseless actions demanding the Lee Myung Bak regime roll back its policy of treachery, that of sycophancy towards the U.S., confrontation with compatriots and fascist dictatorship. 
					
					 It is possible to put an end to this policy only when the conservative regime is brought down. This is the bitter lesson drawn by the south Koreans of different social standings, recollecting the four years of the Lee regime. 
					
					 People of various social strata in south Korea censure Park Geun Hye as the arch criminal who beautified the "May 16 coup" which suppressed at the point of bayonet the popular masses who demanded the democratization of society and national reunification and stubbornly opposed the repeal of the "security law," being a descendant of "yusin" dictator after reducing the "Saenuri Party" into a private party.  They also brand her as a fascist dictator as bad as Lee Myung Bak as she supported the policy of confrontation with the DPRK and was involved in the railroading of the "motion calling for the ratification of FTA" and is still going frantic in the moves to pursue them. 
					
					 The south Korean people know so well that it is impossible to save the inter-Korean relations from collapse and get rid of uneasiness about war nor is it possible to realize the long-cherished desire for independence, democracy and national reunification as long as the conservative group is allowed to stay in power.

articles.title: Staff Members of Chinese Embassy Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Staff Members of Chinese Embassy Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and staff members of his embassy here visited Mangyongdae on Wednesday with the approach of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Chinese guests and students staying in the DPRK also visited there.
					
					 The guests laid a floral basket before a large electronic photo "Great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung in Mangyongdae in flowering month of April" at the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum and paid tribute to him.
					
					 They looked round the historic relics showing the President's inborn disposition and the revolutionary activities of his family members.
					
					 Then they moved to the old home of the President in Mangyongdae and looked round historic relics there, being briefed on Kim Il Sung' start of his revolution in his early years with a great aim to liberate Korea and on the patriotic and revolutionary family members in Mangyongdae.
					
					 They posed for a photo in honor of their visit.

articles.title: Chinese and Overseas Koreans Related to Anti-Japanese Struggle Visit Kim Il Sung’s Statue
articles.content:
Chinese and Overseas Koreans Related to Anti-Japanese Struggle Visit Kim Il Sung’s Statue
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Families of Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Ryongnam Hill and paid homage to him on Wednesday. 
					 They included families of Chen Lei, Shang Yue, Zhang Shoujian, Wang Minggui, Ji Qing and Jiang Zihua. 
					
					 Families of Koreans related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle were among visitors. They were China-residing family of Kim Chol, Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, and overseas-residing Ri Hak Yu, family member of Son Won Thae.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the statue before bowing.
					
					 They arrived in Pyongyang on the same day here to take part in celebrations for the 100th birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Foreigners Arrive in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Foreigners Arrive in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Saul Arana Castellon, Nicaraguan ambassador to the DPRK who is presidential envoy of Nicaragua, arrived here Wednesday to attend the World Congress on the Juche Idea.
					 On the same day a delegation of the Dandong Kwang Myong Sung Energy Research and Development Co. Ltd., headed by its Managing Director Wu Yongzhe and Wang Jing, managing director of the Fenghua Electric Co. articles.title: Foreigners Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit Mangyongdae 
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The delegations and delegates of various countries and regions and international bodies taking part in the international festival to mark the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung visited Mangyongdae on Wednesday.
					 The guests placed a floral basket in the name of all the participants before the old home of the President in deep reverence for him.
					
					 They went round the relics, being briefed on the glorious and revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and the members of patriotic and revolutionary Mangyongdae family.

					 Wu Donghe, chairman of China-Korea Friendship Association, who is heading the delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association, said that the President was not only the great leader of the Korean people but also the close friend of the Chinese people.
					
					 Kosima Weber Liu, executive director of the Environmental Education Media Project, noted that through the visit he came to know more about the revolutionary history of the President.
					
					 Socorro Gomes, president of the World Peace Council, wrote in the visitor's book that the President defeated two strong imperialisms and led socialist construction to victory. He paid his respects to him, he wrote.

articles.title: 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival Opens
articles.content:
28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival Opens
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival opened here in celebration of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 An opening ceremony of the festival took place at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Wednesday. 
					
					 The outside of the venue on the picturesque bank of the River Taedong was festively decorated.
					
					 As the participants of the festival arrived at the venue, senior officials of the party and state congratulated them outside.
					
					 Peasant dances, fan dance, acrobatic pieces and children's peculiar skills presented outside the venue added to the festive atmosphere before the opening of the festival. 
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Choe Yong Rim, premier of the Cabinet, Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, officials concerned, Pyongyang citizens, foreign artistes, overseas Korean artistes, delegations of various countries, diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here, staff members of foreign embassies, foreign guests, overseas Koreans and reporters of various countries.
					
					 DPRK and foreign artistes presented graceful dances. 
					
					 Projected on the screen were scenes showing President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il watching performances given by artistes of various countries of the world and receiving them. 
					
					 The participants broke into applause when a portrait of the dear respected Kim Jong Un appeared on the screen. 
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were made by the Cuban vice-minister of Culture, Sun Xiaohong, head of the Chinese Art Troupe, Chong Ah Kow, head of the Ensemble My Harmonica World of Malaysia, and Leonid Milivanov, head of the Cossack Dance Troupe of Russia.
					
					 They said they were pleased to significantly celebrate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung together with the Korean people, expressing belief that the festival would be splendidly held in line with its idea. 
					
					 Read out at the ceremony were congratulatory messages and letters sent to the festival by governments and prestigious art troupes and famous personages and artistes of various countries. 
					
					 Minister of Culture An Tong Chun, chairman of the festival organizing committee, in his opening address said the participants would decorate the stages with graceful songs and dances and swap successes and experience gained in the development of culture and art, deepening friendship. 
					
					 The flag of the festival was hoisted by DPRK and foreign artistes. 
					
					 There was a performance given by DPRK artistes at the ceremony.

articles.title: International Meeting for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held
articles.content:
International Conference Supporting Reunification of Korea Held
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- An International Conference Supporting the Reunification of Korea took place here Wednesday under the co-sponsorship of the international preparatory committee for celebrating the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung and the Korean Committee for Solidarity with World People.
					 The conference discussed issues of supporting the Korean people in their struggle to reunify the country independently. It also discussed the issue for all the solidarity organizations to conduct activities to ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula and create a favorable atmosphere for its reunification through dialogue and cooperation. 
					
					 Present there were co-chairmen of the international preparatory committee including Guy Dupre, secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea, Socorro Gomes, president of the World Peace Council, and others, delegations and delegates of Nigeria, South Africa, Norway, New Zealand, Nepal, Denmark, Germany, Russia, Mongolia, the U.S., Democratic Congo, Mexico, Bangladesh, Bulgaria, Brazil, Venezuela, Belarus, Sri Lanka, Switzerland, Sweden, Ireland, the UK, Australia, Austria, Iceland, India, Uganda, Uzbekistan, Ukraine, Indonesia, Japan, Spain, Ecuador, Vietnam, Thailand, Pakistan, France, Finland, Colombia, Cuba, Turkey, Poland and Peru and representatives of international organizations.
					
					 Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with World People, officials of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with World People and officials concerned also attended. 
					
					 Guy Dupre made a report.
					
					 Today the Korean people are proudly looking back on the past 100 years when they were led by the great leaders, President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il, he said, and added:
					
					 From the first day of the division of the country the government o the DPRK has put forward the most just and proposals for the reunification of the country at every stage of the development of history and exerted active efforts for their realization.
					
					 More than 300 proposals and initiatives advanced by the Workers' Party of Korea and the government of the DPRK and specific measures for their realization are good illustrations.
					
					 Among them, the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great national unity and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo set forth by Kim Il Sung constitute the three charters for national reunification and remain basic guidelines for it.
					
					 The struggle of the Korean people for reunification guided by these historical lines has entered a new turning point thanks to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration illuminated the most correct orientation and methods for the Korean revolution and the improvement of the north-south relations.
					
					 Friendship and solidarity organizations with the Korean people, the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea and other international organizations have waged a total of over 10 800 solidarity activities including meeting, demonstration, release of statement and publication in support of the just cause of the Korean people.
					
					 The reporter called upon the peace-loving people of the world to lay bare the essence and danger of the anti-reunification policy of escalating the confrontation sought by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities, and conduct positive solidarity activities to provide a favorable international atmosphere for Korea's reunification.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 Socorro Gomes, president of the World Peace Council, said that President Kim Il Sung who made great contributions to the development of the non-aligned movement and the human cause of independence was the leader of the struggle of the world people for independence and peace. 
					
					 Raymond Ferguson, national secretary of the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture, said:
					
					  We have an obligation indeed a duty to wage even more powerful international solidarity activities in support of Songun politics of Korea and the north-south joint declarations.
					
					 Tani Baler Lopera, chairman of the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, said:
					
					 Putting an end to the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK is the shortcut to the Korean reunification.
					
					 Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, noted that the Japanese are bound to realize the normalization of DPRK-Japan diplomatic relations and support Korea's reunification on the basis of the past liquidation.
					
					 The meeting discussed the measures concerning the solidarity movement for supporting Korea's reunification.
					
					 Norma G. Binas, vice-president of the Philippines Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification in the Korean Peninsula, Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, Daniel Alvarez Celi, chairman of the Ecuadorian Committee for Supporting Korea's Independent and Peaceful Reunification, Otete Gaston Mboyo, chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, and Eric Sirotkin, chairman for Korean Peace Program of the National Lawyers Guild of the United States, expressed their will to form more solidarity organizations to support Korea's reunification in different parts of the world and expand the activities in close contact.
					
					 Kim Jin Bom in an address expressed belief that the progressives of the world would extend full support and solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people for the country's reunification.
					
					 A resolution was read out at the meeting.
					
					 The resolution underscored the need to expand and develop the international solidarity campaign in line with the mounting desire of the Korean people for reunification.

articles.title: Int'l Conference Supports Korea's Independent, Peaceful Reunification
articles.content:
Int'l Conference Supports Korea's Independent, Peaceful Reunification 
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- A resolution was read out at the International Conference Supporting the Reunification of Korea in Pyongyang on Wednesday. 
					 The participants in the conference keenly felt the significance of Korea's reunification in achieving peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia and the need for expanding the international solidarity movement so as to suit the ever-rising enthusiasm of the Korean people for reunification, the resolution said, and went on:
					
					 First, we will launch on a broader scale the solidarity movement supporting the just cause of the Korean people to reunify the country as guided by the Three Charters for National Reunification, the grand program of the reunification of Korea. 
					
					 Reaffirming that the realization of the Three Charters for National Reunification is exactly the way towards the reunification of Korea, we will set this as our invariable goal in our struggle to support the reunification of Korea. 
					
					 Second, we will render active support to the Korean people in their efforts to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and launch a vigorous struggle to denounce the present conservative forces of south Korea who deny this and are indulged in vicious anti-DPRK confrontation campaign. 
					
					 We will launch a broad campaign to widely publicize the significance of the north-south joint declarations in realizing the reunification of Korea and organize all over the world protest activities of various forms to expose and denounce the grave consequences of the vicious anti-DPRK confrontation maneuvers of the present south Korean regime. 
					
					 Third, we will denounce the hostile policy of the U.S. which hinders peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula, and strengthen solidarity in support of Songun politics, the fundamental guarantee of reunification. 
					
					 Fourth, we will make more dynamic efforts to make the U.S. withdraw their troops, the main obstacle to reunification, from south Korea and come to the negotiating table to conclude a peace agreement with the DPRK. 
					
					 We will organize various actions to ensure that different governments and international organizations put pressure on the U.S. internationally to make it withdraw its troops from south Korea in accordance with the resolution of the 30th session of the UN General Assembly and accede to the DPRK proposal for a peace agreement. 
					
					 Fifth, we will bring about a new turn in our campaign to support reunification of Korea by achieving unity and solidarity with all the progressive forces of the world who wish for the reunification and peace of Korea. 
					
					 We will wage a vigorous struggle till Korea is reunified, the event so much desired by the Korean people.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Visit Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm

Foreign Guests Visit Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates of organizations for the study of the Juche idea from different countries and regions on a visit to the DPRK to attend the World Congress on the Juche Idea visited the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm on Wednesday.

articles.title: Visiting Delegations of Koreans in China Plant Flower Shrubs on Mansu Hill
articles.content:
Visiting Delegations of Koreans in China Plant Flower Shrubs on Mansu Hill
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The visiting delegations of Koreans in China on Wednesday planted flower shrubs on Mansu Hill.

 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Delegations of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. headed by its Chairman Yun Kil Sang and the Federation of Koreans in Canada led by its Chairperson Kim Su Hae arrived here on Wednesday to take part in celebrations of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Vice-Chairman of S. HQ of Pomminryon Meets Members of N. HQ

 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), met with Chairman Ho Yong Ryul and members of the North Headquarters of Pomminryon at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on Wednesday.

					 Ro Su Hui called upon the young people to carry on their dynamic struggle, inheriting the spirit of forerunners. 
					
					 He underscored the need to vigorously advance hand in hand till the day when the youth in the south and the north would shout hurrah for national reunification based on the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: African Peace Prize Awarded to Great Men of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
African Peace Prize Awarded to Great Men of Mt. Paektu
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The African Peace Fund awarded peace prize and certificate to President Kim Il Sung, general secretary Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the Day of the Sun. 
					 A ceremony of conveying the prize and certificate took place in Nigeria on March 31.
					
					 Present there were personages from the African Peace Fund, the preparatory committee for awarding the African peace prize to celebrate the centenary of the birth of the President, members of Senate of Nigeria, personages from all walks of life and masses in Udi Kingdom, Enugu State. 
					
					 Present on invitation were staff members of the DPRK embassy in Lagos and members of the DPRK technical cooperation group working in the country.
					
					  The international chairman of the African Peace Fund in the meeting praised Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un who performed great feats for the Korean revolution and human cause of independence. 
					
					 The chairman of the preparatory committee for awarding the African peace prize to celebrate the centenary of the birth of the President said that awarding the African peace prize and certificate to the great men of Mt. Paektu is an expression of deep reverence of the Nigerian people and the world progressives for them who made great contributions to ensuring the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats in Leading National Reunification Movement
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats in Leading National Reunification Movement
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime had consistently taken to one-Korea policy for national reunification.
					 He called a joint conference of representatives of political parties and public organizations in the south and north of Korea in Pyongyang in April Juche 37 (1948) to thwart the moves of outside forces and traitors to make the national division de facto.
					
					 In the 1970s, he had the July 4 Joint Statement adopted between the north and the south to bring about a turning phase for Korea's independent and peaceful reunification.
					
					 In each period of developing situation he advanced the most justifiable, realistic and reasonable ways for national reunification. They include the Three Principles of National Reunification, the Proposal for Founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the 10-point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation, which show clear goals and orientation of the reunification movement.
					
					 Kim Il Sung inspired all Koreans to turn out in the efforts for national reunification by embracing everyone regardless of his or her ideology, political view, party affiliation, religion and socio-political records.
					
					 Under his energetic guidance, the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification came to being and signal achievements were made in the cause of great national unity for reunification.
					
					 It was also a reunification-related document on which the President left the last autograph in his lifetime.

articles.title: "Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (25)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (25)
　　　Kim Il Sung's Feat for Preservation of National Cultural Heritages
					 
					
					 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung wisely led the work to preserve and carry forward the national cultural heritages in a proper manner. 
					
					 Tangun, ancestral father of the Korean nation, had been known as a myth until the early 1990s and the history of Tangun's Korea had not yet been verified in a scientific way. 
					
					 On the instructions of the President, an undertaking to excavate Tangun's tomb was conducted on a full scale, and it was proven scientifically that Tangun was not a myth but a real being, who founded the first state of Ancient Korea with Pyongyang as its capital.
					
					 In September Juche 82 (1993), the President instructed officials concerned on the spot to rebuild Tangun's tomb, and examined its final miniature in July 1994. 
					
					 Later, the tomb was reconstructed splendidly as a sacred place of the Korean nation under the energetic guidance of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The President also proposed a campaign to ascertain the relics found out in and around King Tongmyong's mausoleum and wrote such epigraph as "Monument to Reconstructed Mausoleum of King Tongmyong".
					
					 In May 1992 he visited the mausoleum of King Wang Kon in Kaesong and called for its reconstruction. When the project was finished, he personally wrote an epigraph reading "Monument to Reconstructed Mausoleum of King Wang Kon, Founder of Koryo".
					
					He guided the work to properly formulate the history of the Korean nation with a Juche-based viewpoint. 
					
					 He urged officials to deepen the study of the history of Tangun and Ancient Korea and put straight the distorted or wrong history records with Juche-oriented stand. 
					
					 His guidance led to making clear the entire picture of Korea's primitive history and establishing in a systematic way its ancient history centered on Ancient Korea and medieval history on Koguryo Kingdom (277 B.C.-668 A.D.), formulating the Korean nation's history of 5 000 years from a fresh angle.
					
					 In May 1992, the President visited the Koryo Songgyungwan Academy in Kaesong, the highest educational institution in the period of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392), stressing that it is more significant to turn the building into a university inheriting the academy than to display it as a mere showcase to visitors.
					
					 And he sent the signboard of the university "The Koryo Songgyungwan Academy" written by his own hand, and advised officials to set September 1, 992 when its predecessor Kukjagam was established, as its birthday. 
					
					 The President saw to it that Rijo Sillok (Chronicles of the Ri Dynasty) and other national classics were translated in Korean and published and the traditional customs and lifestyle inherited and developed as required by the present times.
					
					 At the Sixth Session of the Ninth Supreme People's Assembly, the President suggested discussing the issue of improving the work to properly carry forward and develop the national cultural heritages. 
					
					 At the Seventh Session of the Ninth SPA in April 1994, the President recommended adopting a DPRK law on protection of cultural heritages.

articles.title: Branch School on Rap Islet of DPRK
articles.content:
Branch School on Rap Islet of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- On Rap Islet in the west sea of Korea, there is a branch school operating for the light-keepers' children.
					 In Jong Sun, who has worked as a teacher at the school for 18 years, told KCNA that the branch school could operate on a normal basis, backed by the sincere assistance of servicepersons.
					
					She said:
					
					 During a winter school vacation 12 years ago, I was staying on the land to prepare for a new-school-term education at the mother school in Sinuiju City. As the school opening day approached, I was worried, for fear that I would not be able to reach the islet in time, because blocks of ices had left the sea route closed.
					
					Upon hearing the news, servicepersons took me to the islet onboard a large-sized diesel boat.
					
					 Later, they built a playground in the branch school and supplied teaching materials to it. 
					
					 A film featuring their admirable deeds came out years ago.
					
					 There was no enrollment in the school for a few years but it has existed as ever.
					
					 Two children are now studying at the school.
					
					Such a kind of schools are scattered on islets in the east and west sea of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Awarded Highest Honor Prize of DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Awarded Highest Honor Prize of DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- It was announced in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on Monday that Kim Il Sung Prize was conferred on general secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					 Awarding this highest honor prize to the leader is an expression of the DPRK people's boundless loyalty to him.
					
					 Kim Jong Il showed the road ahead of the Korean revolution and the times with his encyclopedic ideas and theories and ushered in the golden age of building socialist culture in Korea.
					
					 He strengthened the party, army and state under the banner of modeling the whole society on the Juche idea and brought about a great heyday of prosperity, unprecedented in the nation's history of 5 000 years.
					
					 He developed in depth the immortal Juche idea, the Songun (military-first) idea into the guiding idea in the era of independence. And he propelled the drive to put the national economy on a Juche-oriented, modern and scientific basis by setting priority to science and technology as one of the three mainstays in the building of a powerful nation.
					
					 The leader brought about not only a great heyday of literature and art in the era of Songun but also a fresh turn in building socialist culture such as education, health service, media and sports.
					
					 Kim Jong Il had already been awarded the prize in Juche 62 (1973).
					
					 The prize was instituted in March 1972.

articles.title: Exhibition of Works on Juche Idea
articles.content:
Exhibition of Works on Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Exhibition of Works on the Juche Idea finds itself at the Three-revolution Exhibition in Pyongyang.
					 The exhibition, which provides a glimpse of ideological and theoretical activities by President Kim Il Sung, general secretary Kim Jong Il and an anti-Japanese war hero, Kim Jong Suk, was opened to visitors in December Juche 87 (1998).
					
					 In the hall of its first floor there is a marble statue of Kim Il Sung standing against the background of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 On either side of the hall are displays of Kim Il Sung's works and Kim Jong Il's works.
					
					 Kim Il Sung authored more than 10 800 works in his lifetime, and some of them are put on display.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's works on display vividly represent his authorship.
					
					 The second floor has displays of documentary materials on Kim Jong Suk's activities. Also translated versions of works on the Juche idea, which were published and disseminated in 120 odd countries, are on display by each continent and country.
					
					 24 978 280 copies have been released in 60 odd languages so far.
					
					 Kim Kyong Suk, a chief lecturer, told KCNA that the number of visitors to the exhibition is increasing days ahead of Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary (April 15), several thousands a day.
					
					 Among the visitors are foreigners and overseas Koreans, she said.

articles.title: Loving Care Shown to Hospitals in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Loving Care Shown to Hospitals in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on Monday sent wild honey and various kinds of foodstuff to hospitals in Pyongyang, including Korea General Red-Cross Hospital, Pyongyang Maternity Hospital and Kim Man Yu Hospital.
					 Sim Il Chol, director of the Korea General Red-Cross Hospital, told KCNA that Kim Jong Un, identical to President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il in love for the people, sent wild honey and varieties of foodstuff to in-patients, in order to help them enjoy the April 15 holiday and recover their health.
					
					 This is indicative of his noble personality, he said.
					
					 Pak Tong Sun, a researcher at the Kangwon Provincial Institute of Forestry Science, who is undergoing treatment at the Urology Hospital, said that Kim Jong Un is as good as father for the Korean people. Such kind of practice can be seen only in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea where the leader and the people form an integral whole.
					
					 Kim Phyong Ju, a worker at the Hyesan Direct Sale Store in Ryanggang Province, who underwent a major surgical operation at the hospital, said Kim Jong Un's loving care, more intense than the parental one, has turned to be elixir for her. She reiterated her determination to devotedly work for building a thriving nation after recovering her health.
					
					 Pak Ju Myong, vice-director of Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, said Kim Jong Un had already sent a large quantity of wild honey to the in-patients of the maternity hospital on the Day of the Shining Star (February 16).
					
					 I am sorely missing Kim Jong Il, who led the work to build this modern maternity hospital for improvement of health of women and newborns and sent latest medical equipment, along with tonics and nutrients, he said, adding:
					
					 Indeed, Kim Jong Un is little different to Kim Jong Il, who had intense love for the people.
					
					 Kim Sun Ok, a mother of triplets living in Jangchung-dong 2, Songyo District, Pyongyang, said that she has been getting medical treatment at Pyongyang Maternity Hospital for 100 days.
					
					 "I am waiting for the day to leave the hospital. But Kim Jong Un's loving care reached me, too. I will bring up my children to be true to him."
					
					 Ye Myong Ryong, an in-patient at Kim Man Yu Hospital who is a worker at the Ryongsong, Pyongyang City, District People's Committee, said that he would devotedly work in order to repay Kim Jong Un's loving care.
					
					 A section chief of Kim Man Yu Hospital, Kim Uk, said he would work harder to give full play to the advantage of the socialist health care system.

articles.title: Foreign Parties, Figures Support DPRK's Planned Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Foreign Parties, Figures Support DPRK's Planned Satellite Launch
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's projected launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 has been supported by foreign political parties and figures.
					 The Workers' Party, Communist Party, Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist),  Socialist Party and National Socialist Party of Bangladesh in a joint statement on April 5 said it is the exercise of a legitimate, independent right for the DPRK to develop space for peaceful purposes.
					
					 No country has a right to find faults with the DPRK's satellite launch, the statement noted.
					
					 Chairman of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Unity Party of Indonesia Nurdin Purnomo and its Secretary General Harinde Singh in a joint statement on April 5 said it is an auspicious event for the DPRK to launch satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 with its indigenous technology, adding it deserves appreciation.
					
					 The National Leading Council of the Diversity Unity Party extends full support and solidarity to the DPRK's launch of the application satellite and hopes for signal success, it noted.
					
					 Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, in a statement on April 3 said the satellite launch is an expression of the greatest respect for President Kim Il Sung on the centenary of his birth and a proof of the great vitality of the immortal Juche idea.
					
					 The Brazilian Centre for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted articles on websites on April 2 supporting the projected launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.

articles.title: Day of Sun Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included meetings, seminars, book and photo exhibitions, film shows and concerts in Thailand, Peru, UK, India, Mexico and Nepal between March 31 and April 4.
					
					 On display in the venues were works of Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il and the books and photos showing the revolutionary careers and feats of the peerlessly great men and introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Korean films shown included "Tracing the traditional martial arts of the Korean nation" and "A Schoolgirl's Diary".
					
					 Staged in concerts were "Song of General Kim Il Sung" and "Song of General Kim Jong Il", immortal revolutionary hymns, and other Korean songs.

articles.title: President of Malta on Boosting Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
President of Malta on Boosting Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The untimely demise of general secretary Kim Jong Il at the end of last year was the greatest loss to the Korean people.
					 George Abela, president of Malta, said this, expressing again his deep condolences on the demise when meeting with Han Tae Song, DPRK ambassador to Malta, who paid a farewell visit to him on April 5.
					
					 The president said he was pleased with the great achievements made by the DPRK in building a thriving nation under the wise guidance of Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He expressed belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between Malta and the DPRK would steadily develop in various fields including politics, economy and culture in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Introduced
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Introduced 
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups with portraits of a smiling President Kim Il Sung to mark his birth anniversary.
					 The Lao paper Congtap Pasason Lao on April 4 in an article titled "Political idea of Comrade Kim Il Sung" said the President's was a life dedicated to the people.
					
					 The paper said that the President dedicated his all to the people, regarding them as the best teacher.
					
					 The Peruvian paper Accion Nacionalista in its March issue devoted one whole page to an article titled "Glory to the great leader President Kim Il Sung on the centenary of his birth".
					
					 The paper praised him as a great man and prominent leader who worked miracles and brought about changes by leading the DPRK along the road of independence.
					
					 The Nigerian paper Daily Sun on April 2 introduced the noble revolutionary career of the President and the feats he performed on behalf of the country, revolution, era and humankind.
